intro: Sideroxylon persimile subsp. subsessiliflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage, with lanceolate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color, followed by woody, spherical fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Its resilience and unique morphology make it an important species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
